subject: Re: Good Box...Bad Box
author: Steve Hultay
full_text:
Here's the Link to EVP maker.

http://www.stefanbion.de/evpmaker/index_e.htm

-Steve H.



--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Frank Sumption" <franks-boxes@...> 
wrote:
>
> I think you'd be better served to try the simpler methods first, 
if those 
> don't work, chances are a box won't either. I think almost 
everyone is 
> basing their expectations of the boxes on Moon's claims, which may 
be highly 
> exaggerated. Besides, it's not Like I can just throw this stuff 
together, 
> despite Moon telling the world I give it away. I give away the 
proto types 
> I'm done with, and don't have any at the moment.
> 
> Many of the other methods work as well as my stuff, such as 
EVPmaker, the 
> various direct radio voice methods.  They have a huge advantage--
simple and 
> cheap! I swear, all I do  is the same, provide a source of raw 
audio.
> 
> Frank
> 
> 
> >From: erick hunter <erick_hunter9@...>
> >Reply-To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> >To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> >Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Good Box...Bad Box
> >Date: Mon, 30 Jul 2007 07:32:10 -0700 (PDT)
> >
> >Mr. Sumption, I would like very much like to receive information 
as to 
> >acquiring one of your Boxes. I am a serious, independant 
Paranormal 
> >researcher, Not! a de-tractor of your instrument, not by any 
means. I 
> >mention this here because I've followed the various exchanges of 
> >information, and "information," concerning your instrument. I've 
reviewed 
> >the sound bytes posted and am very impressed with the results. I 
would 
> >appreciate a responce, one way or the other, from you at your 
convenience. 
> >Thank you in advance.   --Rod
> >
> >
> >
> >
> >Frank Sumption <franks-boxes@...> wrote:
> >           I never paid much attention as to which boxes produced 
more 
> >negatives, but I
> >used to get alot when I first started this stuff. I tend to 
ignore those,
> >and sometimes if it's in a segment I copy to the computer I'll 
play it
> >backward. Reversed, sometimes the evil voices are angelic. That's 
curious
> >about it shutting off aplliances, I thought those ran on internal 
> >batteries.
> >Maybe you're getting a lesson in energies?
> >
> >I did get a quake warning in last nights test, it said China 
suffers a
> >quake, followed by August 11. I usually don't get dates, or 
locations, so I
> >guess wait any see, of maybe they can evacuate China? Often, when 
a quake 
> >is
> >coming I get a wolf image, well there's a wolf face on the shower 
window,
> >kind of a medium size wolf, so I think if there is a quake it 
won't be real
> >severe, maybe like a 6 or 7. Wolves for quakes, cats for wind, 
and bears 
> >for
> >tsunamis, which I didn't know ahead of time. For Katrina I had a 
cat(image)
> >with huge round eyes.
> >
> >Frank
> > >From: "Steve Hultay" <urkel23@...>
> > >Reply-To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> > >To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> > >Subject: [EVP-ITC] Good Box...Bad Box
> > >Date: Mon, 30 Jul 2007 00:42:01 -0000
> > >
> > >
> > >Does anybody think it's possible to get 2 extreme opposites in
> > >communication? 1 Box curses at me constantly and tells me to 
die and
> > >also talks about the end of the world and hell. And the other 
one
> > >talks about how pretty it is there and i always get "Hi" 
and "I'm
> > >Here" as well as "Don't leave" when i'm signing off and an
> > >occasional "Goodbye". Has anyone experienced anything like this
> > >before? The 1 box even shuts off appliances in my house when i 
use
> > >it, i guess i'll stop using that one for now until i figure out 
a
> > >solution to what's going on. Any ideas?????
> > >
> > >-Steve H.
> > >
